headline: Honeywell to sell PPE business in $1.33 billion deal
summary: Honeywell (HON) struck a deal to sell its PPE (personal protective equipment) business to Protective Industrial Products for $1.33 billion. Market Domination hosts Julie Hyman and Madison Mills report more on this story. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here. This post was written by Luke Carberry Mogan.

headline: MicroStrategy, UPS, Honeywell: 3 trending headlines
summary: Citron Research shorts MicroStrategy (MSTR), which is considered to be a bitcoin (BTC-USD) proxy, citing the stock is untethered from the cryptocurrency's fundamentals. UPS (UPS) will pay $45 million to the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) for failing to use generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP) when evaluating its freight segment, which the SEC said misrepresented the value of the business. Honeywell (HON) will sell its personal protective equipment (PPE) business for $1.33 billion amid ongoing pressures from activist investors. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Wealth here. This post was written by Naomi Buchanan.

headline: Honeywell Cashes Out: $1.325 Billion PPE Business Sale Fuels Bold Portfolio Transformation
summary: Honeywell International Inc. (NASDAQ:HON) shares are trading higher on Friday. The company has agreed to sell its Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) business to Protective Industrial Products, Inc. (PIP) for $1.325 billion in an all-cash deal. This move aligns with Honeywell’s strategy to streamline its portfolio, focusing on core businesses and pursuing high-return acquisitions that support its three key megatrends: automation, the future of aviation, and energy transition. headline: Honeywell to Sell Personal Protective Equipment Unit for $1.33 Billion
summary: Honeywell International has agreed to sell its personal-protective-equipment business to a private-equity firm’s portfolio company for $1.33 billion in cash.

raw.headline: Honeywell to Sell Personal Protective Equipment Unit for $1.33 Billion
raw.summary: Honeywell International has agreed to sell its personal-protective-equipment business to a private-equity firm’s portfolio company for $1.33 billion in cash.

headline: Honeywell to sell personal protective equipment business for $1.33 billion
summary: A potential sale of the PPE business was disclosed before activist Elliott Investment called for a split of the company's aerospace and automation businesses after taking a $5 billion-plus stake.  Since taking charge last year, CEO Vimal Kapur has looked to align Honeywell's portfolio to a shift to the so-called megatrends of automation, aviation and energy transition.  The sale of the PPE business, which is part of the company's industrial automation segment, is expected to close in the first half of 2025.

raw.headline: Honeywell to sell personal protective equipment business for $1.33 billion
raw.summary: A potential sale of the PPE business was disclosed before activist Elliott Investment called for a split of the company's aerospace and automation businesses after taking a $5 billion-plus stake.  Since taking charge last year, CEO Vimal Kapur has looked to align Honeywell's portfolio to a shift to the so-called megatrends of automation, aviation and energy transition.  The sale of the PPE business, which is part of the company's industrial automation segment, is expected to close in the first half of 2025.

headline: HONEYWELL TO SELL PERSONAL PROTECTIVE EQUIPMENT BUSINESS TO PROTECTIVE INDUSTRIAL PRODUCTS
summary: Honeywell (NASDAQ: HON) announced today that it has agreed to sell its Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) business to Protective Industrial Products, Inc. ("PIP"), a portfolio company of Odyssey Investment Partners, for $1.325 billion in an all-cash transaction. The transaction will enable Honeywell to further simplify its portfolio in order to accelerate value creation in alignment with three compelling megatrends: automation, the future of aviation and energy transition.

The transaction will enable Honeywell to further simplify its portfolio in order to accelerate value creation in alignment with three compelling megatrends: automation, the future of aviation and energy transition.
